visualize
Class PostElement3DDisplay

java.lang.Object
  visualize.PostElement3DDisplay

public class PostElement3DDisplay
extends java.lang.Object

Class for drawing 3D element results for the post-visualizer.

Author:
Murat

Constructor Detail

PostElement3DDisplay

public PostElement3DDisplay(Structure structure,
                            double maxDistance,
                            double minDistance,
                            double maxDisplacement)
Creates PostElement3DDisplay object.

Parameters:
structure - The structure to be drawn.
maxDistance - The maximum distance of the structure.
minDistance - The minimum distance of the structure.
maxDisplacement - The maximum displacement of a node computed after the analysis.
Method Detail

setScalingFactor

protected void setScalingFactor(java.lang.Double scale)
Sets factor for scaling nodal displacements.

Parameters:
scale - The scaling factor.

draw

protected void draw(SolidMAT owner,
                    int shape,
                    int option,
                    int[] comp,
                    boolean isScaled)
Draws three dimensional elements and related results.

Parameters:
owner - The owner frame of drawing.
shape - Parameter for drawing deformed or undeformed shape.
option - The result option for drawing results.
comp - The component of demanded result to be visualized.
isScaled - True if displacements are scaled, false if not.

drawElement

private void drawElement(Element3D e3D,
                         DVec[] pos)
Draws three dimensional elements as polygons.

Parameters:
e3D - Three dimensional element.
pos - Array storing the nodal position vectors of element.

drawResults

private void drawResults(Element3D e3D,
                         int index,
                         DVec[] pos)
Draws result diagram.

Parameters:
e3D - Three dimensional element that the diagram will be drawn on.
index - The index of element.
pos - Array storing the nodal position vectors of element.

option - The result option to be displayed.

checkOption

private java.lang.String checkOption(int option,
                                     int[] comp)
Checks result option.

Parameters:
option - The result option to be drawn.
comp - The component of the result to be displayed.
Returns:
Result option if available, null vice versa.
